alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Florence (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 01 at 11:23AM EDT until September 02 at 12:41AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina...South Carolina... Northeast Cape Fear River Near Burgaw affecting Pender County. Black River At Kingstree affecting Williamsburg County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina...South Carolina... Lumber River Near Lumberton affecting Robeson County. Lumber River 1 SE Nichols affecting Dillon, Horry and Marion Counties. Black Creek At Quinby affecting Florence and Darlington Counties. Little Pee Dee River At Galivants Ferry affecting Marion and Horry Counties. For the Northeast Cape Fear River...including Burgaw...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Lumber River...including Nichols, Pembroke, Lumberton Usgs Gage, Maxton, Lumberton, Boardman...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Little Pee Dee River...including Galivants Ferry...Major flooding is forecast. For the Black River...including Kingstree...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Black Creek at Quinby. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flood stage. Creek coming out of its banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 7.2 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=ilm . The next statement will be issued by late tonight.
